meanings.sent1: The detective surveyed the crime scene for any clues.
meanings.sent2: The scientist surveyed the data to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat surveyed the room before deciding to explore.
meanings.sent4: The teacher surveyed the students' progress throughout the semester.
meanings.sent5: The explorer surveyed the vast landscape before embarking on the journey.

meanings.definition: Look carefully and thoroughly at (someone or something), especially so as to appraise them.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler surveyed the diamond for any imperfections.
meanings.sent2: The art critic surveyed the painting before giving their review.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer surveyed the fabric for the new collection.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent surveyed the property before listing it for sale.
meanings.sent5: The inspector surveyed the building for structural integrity.

meanings.definition: Investigate the opinions or experience of (a group of people) by asking them questions.
meanings.sent1: The researcher surveyed the participants to gather feedback.
meanings.sent2: The company surveyed their customers to improve their services.
meanings.sent3: The student council surveyed the students for their event preferences.
meanings.sent4: The journalist surveyed the public for their views on the new policy.
meanings.sent5: The chef surveyed the diners to enhance the menu offerings.
